However, from an experimental standpoint, this scenario presents a clear choice regarding inequality aversion. 

The Left option provides a larger payoff for me (600) but gives Person A nothing. The Right option gives me a smaller payoff (400) but provides Person A with an equal payoff (400). 

Given my interest in social behavior, even if it's in invertebrates, I am somewhat incentivized to explore options that reduce inequality, as this may have implications for the overall dynamics of the group. Although there's no explicit group in this experiment, I would be more intrigued to see how people behave in a fairer environment. 

Therefore, even though my instinct might be to select the higher payout on the Left, I choose Right, to get closer towards equal pay.
